info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cleveland, northwestern York and northern Cherokee Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Gaffney, or 6 miles south of Boiling Springs NC, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Shelby, Kings Mountain, Boiling Springs NC, Blacksburg, Grover, Patterson Springs, Earl, Kings Mountain State Park and Crowders Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
